title: Taiyuan
summary: Taiyuan (/ˌtaɪjuˈɑːn/;[5] Chinese: 太原; pinyin: Tàiyuán; Mandarin pronunciation: [tʰâi.ɥɛ̌n]; also known as Bīng (并), Jìnyáng (晋阳))[6] is the capital and largest city of Shanxi Province, People's Republic of China.[7] It is one of the main manufacturing bases of China. Throughout its long history, Taiyuan was the capital or provisional capital of many dynasties in China, hence the name Lóngchéng (龙城; Dragon City).[8]
